messages: 906cca2a5ed603c0f4e8b08b56a80768 (19:48): hub, MarcoZ, we should have a target for when we want to ship FF OSX with a11y built in.
906cca2a5ed603c0f4e8b08b56a80768 (19:48): our Q1 goal isn't precisely this.
940baac7a8cf188d66395b0115b78dc5 (19:48): and a plan to enable it for wild testing with possibility to revert
940baac7a8cf188d66395b0115b78dc5 (19:49): like enable it for Aurora N and if at the time of beta it does not satisfy, disable it
906cca2a5ed603c0f4e8b08b56a80768 (19:49): hub:  or is there a clean way to pref off the engine activation?
3fe145094f808469bffe4e30453f94c1 (19:49): hub: I arrive on the evening of the 28th of Feb, and leave early morning March 4 (Sunday).
940baac7a8cf188d66395b0115b78dc5 (19:49): we should be able to do that too
940baac7a8cf188d66395b0115b78dc5 (19:49): MarcoZ: ok. thanks
3fe145094f808469bffe4e30453f94c1 (19:52): was thinking 13 could be our lucky number.

3fe145094f808469bffe4e30453f94c1 (19:52): I think 12 is too premature for having it enabled in nightlies, but having iit enabled after the next merge (which puts nightlies on number 13) would be cool.
906cca2a5ed603c0f4e8b08b56a80768 (19:56): 13 is a good target
3fe145094f808469bffe4e30453f94c1 (20:00): davidb: This patch looks nice and small! :D
3fe145094f808469bffe4e30453f94c1 (20:03): davidb: hub: Wow, quite some comments on both my English and German blog posts about Mac a11y, and quite a number of retweets!
940baac7a8cf188d66395b0115b78dc5 (20:03): MarcoZ: awesome
3fe145094f808469bffe4e30453f94c1 (20:10): OK guys, will call it a night. see you tomorrow!
906cca2a5ed603c0f4e8b08b56a80768 (20:13): hub I added a meeting note, sound good? https://wiki.mozilla.org/Platform/2012-01-17#Accessibility
940baac7a8cf188d66395b0115b78dc5 (20:14): sounds good
906cca2a5ed603c0f4e8b08b56a80768 (20:31): hub: please try to get a plan posted by end of day tomorrow - maybe coord with Marco if needed.
906cca2a5ed603c0f4e8b08b56a80768 (20:31): exciting.
940baac7a8cf188d66395b0115b78dc5 (20:46): so from now on, I'll push in accessibility
906cca2a5ed603c0f4e8b08b56a80768 (20:47): hub: sounds good for now
940baac7a8cf188d66395b0115b78dc5 (20:48): now if I could get my patches with a r+ :-)
906cca2a5ed603c0f4e8b08b56a80768 (20:50): hi surkov!
940baac7a8cf188d66395b0115b78dc5 (20:56): hey surkov.
47e87577fff6e08b0f2f43540db8c9c9 (20:59): Bug https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=715824 nor, --, ---, nobody, NEW, A11y in B2G
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (21:18): hub: I hear writing patches I really like helps there ;)
940baac7a8cf188d66395b0115b78dc5 (21:21): ok, going to the office now. see you in but
4b67ec162b8759d8c6b806a11ba0d9fd (21:26): i wonder how i send DTMF codes over SIP
4b67ec162b8759d8c6b806a11ba0d9fd (21:27): oh i just type keys!
906cca2a5ed603c0f4e8b08b56a80768 (21:32): surkov: we were talking about embedded characters‚Ä¶ and about if we should get rid of them.
f5137d105ccd11d3c4384e8e8573b3c8 (21:33): davidb: good, details?
906cca2a5ed603c0f4e8b08b56a80768 (21:33): It might be good to do while we have NVDA attention.
906cca2a5ed603c0f4e8b08b56a80768 (21:33): no details yet
906cca2a5ed603c0f4e8b08b56a80768 (21:34): surkov: is this something that we could do Q2/Q3?
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (21:34): davidb: surkov  well, just for hyperlinks for now
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (21:34): though I'd expect that's the bigest use by far
f5137d105ccd11d3c4384e8e8573b3c8 (21:35): davidb: that's a part of openAT plans, q2-q3 sounds reasonable
906cca2a5ed603c0f4e8b08b56a80768 (21:35): ok great
f5137d105ccd11d3c4384e8e8573b3c8 (21:36): tbsaunde: maybe - because we need to come with well-defined approach
f5137d105ccd11d3c4384e8e8573b3c8 (21:36): it could be easier to do all at once rather than by parts
906cca2a5ed603c0f4e8b08b56a80768 (21:37): shivers
f5137d105ccd11d3c4384e8e8573b3c8 (21:37): but I didn't looked at issue in details yet
906cca2a5ed603c0f4e8b08b56a80768 (21:37): oh i get you
906cca2a5ed603c0f4e8b08b56a80768 (21:37): yes you might be right
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (21:37): yeah, maybe
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (21:37): or maybe just write a new text interface??
f5137d105ccd11d3c4384e8e8573b3c8 (21:38): good option
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (21:38): surkov: didn't you say you wanted to do that anyway?
f5137d105ccd11d3c4384e8e8573b3c8 (21:38): ia2 is not active though
f5137d105ccd11d3c4384e8e8573b3c8 (21:38): not exactly
f5137d105ccd11d3c4384e8e8573b3c8 (21:38): btw, we have wiki for that
f5137d105ccd11d3c4384e8e8573b3c8 (21:38): I put there some initial thoughts
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (21:39): kyeah, I remember
f5137d105ccd11d3c4384e8e8573b3c8 (21:39): https://wiki.mozilla.org/Accessibility/TextImplementation
94d50e2efa8ecc99acd742d7cdd18f4a (21:39): I haven't really thought much about it, and don't really expect to for a while
f5137d105ccd11d3c4384e8e8573b3c8 (21:39): same for the first part :)
